10/2017

üè∑Ô∏è"A complex and smooth, somewhat earthy, nutty flavour."

 

SUGGESTED DILUTION RATIO: 2-4% - wonderflavours.com
"...SC should be started standalone at 1% up to 4%" - Frank EBlender | WFlavors |11/2017
_________________

üìë " Walnut...in general, fairly mild, but it has a complexity that includes some 
tangy and sharp notes. Researchers have identified 3 contributors to this bite: oil 
content, a tendency to become rancid if not stored properly, and the tannins in the
 walnut skin. Dr. George Ennis, flavor chemist at David Michael & Company... "The 
astringent taste is a result of the tannins and catechin from the paper-like skin (pellicle)
 surrounding the nut kernel." - https://walnuts.org/

 

"...English walnuts...have a milder taste...thinner, easier-to-crack shells.  Black 
Walnuts...have a bolder, earthier flavor..shells are thick, tough to crack...will likely stain
our hands" - http://www.seriouseats.com
__________________________________________________
